Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: LA_dweller
Reviews.Content: This hotel really gets a 5 star for location - across the street from CBS Television City, 5 minute walk to Farmer's Market, the famous 24 hour Canters restaurant, just minutes to Fairfax, nice restaurants right next door and in every direction including good fast food (subway, etc.) post office and park diagonally across the street, Good cute Coffee House just 2 minute walk away, Health food store across the street too... However... For hotel quality it gets a 1 - hence my 3 star average. I have stayed there many times on business and the beds are always clean, maid staff is great BUT depending on the room you get, there can be black mold in places in the bathroom, stains here or there on the carpet or floor, I don't think there's been any painting or sprucing up in at least 5 years. Old heaters & air conditioners in room some of which might have difficulty. It's kinda like a crummy motel 6. If you don't mind that, then go for it and save the money because it's the cheapest hotel in the area. If you have money to spare or blow then I highly recommend you don't bother with this place and stay at the Farmer's Daughter just a block away. Even the Roadside in (a half block away) is better (but more money) although not better by much. Staff is nice and helpful. Shuttles pick up out front if you want one. Bus stops everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal in a Great location.”
Reviews.Author: lovely090
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Beverly Inn Motel for 5 nights and had a great stay - the location is amazing as it's pretty much central within LA. Lots of interesting things are nearby: Farmer's Market, The Grove shopping area, LACMA, and the surrounding Fairfax District with lots of interior design shops and good vintage clothes shops. There's also buses which take you to Los Feliz and Silver Lake from two blocks north which is really handy. All of the staff are really friendly, and went out of their way to be kind and help out with taxi's etc. I couldn't recommend this hotel enough, and have also recommended it to friends of ours as a great place to stay. I will always look to the Beverly Inn first. Don't believe other reviews do experience by your self.

Reviews.Title: “Do not STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: Richardllew
Reviews.Content: This is one of the worse motels that I have ever stayed at. I got locked in the bathroom because the handle was broken, there seemed to be bugs in the bed the mattress was very bad, It smelled, and there was a building with NO VIEW except a wall. They say they offer Coffee but the doors are locked to the office and there was none. the people was not nice just a very bad experience all together. Stay away from this place......No parking except in very small places.

Reviews.Title: “Fit for the Thrifty Traveler”
Reviews.Author: travelleronadime
Reviews.Content: Choose this hotel only if youre on a budget and prefer its proximity to locations. For the price dont expect a sparkling luxury room, it's an older place but the rooms are clean and spacious, beds are comfortable, and bathrooms are functioning with decent water pressure. The hosts are a nice friendly family that do their best to be helpful. My only note of concern is that all rooms on the two floors face inward to the center pool courtyard, so all noise echoes into rooms. I was awaken on more than one occasion by other guests hanging out in the courtyard in the afternoon or returning to their room at 3am. Probably a pair of earplugs is a simple solution for that issue. If I visit the area again, I would definitely consider returning to the Beverly Inn.

Reviews.Title: “STAY AWAY!”
Reviews.Author: DavidRTX
Reviews.Content: YUCK! Not only is this place one of the most dated motels I've ever been in, the pool is virtually unusable, it's noisy, the internet is VERY slow, and, if you want ice, you have to buy it from a vending machine.

Reviews.Title: “It's a HOLE!”
Reviews.Author: dragonflywhispers
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel due to the location...and that is basically the only thing going for it. The neighbourhood is safe ...and convenient to The Grove and Farmers Market. Our room was dark and seedy...a small window that had a lovely view to a brick wall and back alley...and could hear everything happening in the room nextdoor. Luckily we only stayed for a couple of nights so we could see the sights of that end of Hollywood...and as soon as morning came...bags were packed and we were out of there. Seeya - bye! Won't be choosing to stay here again...lesson learnt.

Reviews.Title: “Spend a little more and stay somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: steiny4
Reviews.Content: We were going to the Price is Right and wanted to stay close to CBS. We saw the price of this hotel and booked thinking, "It can't be that bad." We were wrong. The room was not equipped for the four of us. It had two towels and a few wash rags. We called for more and were greeted unpleasantly by the front desk woman who was visibly irritated that we had asked for towels. That was just the beginning. Our sink had a rusty razor blade stuck in the drain. The towels that we recieved had hair on them from the previous users, and to top it all off, I woke up with a cockroach above my head in the morning. Needless to say we didn't stay more than one night. We had planned to stay 2 nights. The front desk woman did refund our second night.

Reviews.Title: “Yikes...the pool looks like it's set up for inmates”
Reviews.Author: labonvoyer
Reviews.Content: Love to come to LA and stay close to Grove/Farmer's Market. Started off staying at The Farmer's Daughter, then prices went up. Found the Beverly Laurel Motor Motel and stayed there (see review). I was in a hurry and went to book what I thought was the afformentioned Motel, thinking boy their prices are just fantastic. As I was going down Beverly Blvd being guided by my GPS, she passed the Beverly Laurel and continued down Beverly Blvd until "Your destination is on the left"-The Beverly Inn. I suddenly realized my booking mistake. My husband and I decided to make the best of it. Here are the pluses: 1. Free Parking (We paid for overnight Parking at the Grove because spots are small for our 4WD and wasn't comfortable to park on street as suggested by front desk. 2.Walkable distance to The Grove Farmer's Mkt 3.Low Price Having said that, I would not stay again. The room appeared clean but it was odd. For example the telephone was missing some of the push buttons and the wastebaskets were lined with grocery store plastic bags. We got in about 1030pm and heard a drip coming from the bathroom.. Looking up, it was apparent the upstairs room had a leak in the toliet area. My husband asked to change rooms (no one wants to be on the commode and be hit with a drip from the upstairs toliet). They did accomodate that, but who wants to change rooms at that time. Also, don't be seduced by the fact they have a pool. The pool is a std small kidney pool. But the odd thing is, is that it has a fence around it that starts at the edge of the pool and looks like a "Pool Prison". Outside of the fencing, there is no lounge chairs or anyplace to relax by the pool. They'd do better to turn the pool into a Koi pond and put plants around it. Cheap ,but for this budget traveler, not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Certainly not the best”
Reviews.Author: pammom3
Reviews.Content: It was a good value. The location was the reason why we booked this at hotel ) as it is right across the street from CBS studios. West Hollywood is not the best part of town. Saw many homeless people on the streets right by the hotel and overall did not feel very safe in the surroundings. The hotel just gave me the creeps. It needs to be updated. The furniture was old and the beds were uncomfortable. I couldn't wait to check out and would have left earlier if I didn't need to be close to the studio.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful surprise”
Reviews.Author: dicksyatt
Reviews.Content: For an inexpensive motel, I did not expect much. My expectations were exceeded. Friendly, clean, great great area to walk and eat in. Like a neighborhood. The management was wonderful. Not a Marriott...a small motel. Great value. Loved my stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Met every Expectation!”
Reviews.Author: felixthekat87
Reviews.Content: My Friend and I stayed at this hotel because we went to a concert at the El Rey theater. It was every thing we expected for the price. Great location, parking wasn't too bad, and the front desk even called us a cab when we needed a ride to the theater. The room was decent and the bed had clean sheets. The only thing I would complain about is the lack of seals on the door. You could pretty much hear everything that was going on outside. For some reason people decided to get up early (about 7:00am) and hang around on the balcony and talk loudly. Besides the early risers, this place great! I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Front Desk Was Totally Awesome!!!!”
Reviews.Author: kathychurch111
Reviews.Content: This motel may not be the Ritz Carlton but if your looking for value, a great location and safe neighborhood then you've chosen the right place! It is right across the street from the CBS studios, the line for the price is right is just around the corner. My son and I stayed there for a week and received great service from the maids right on to the front desk. The front desk was more helpful than any concierge I have ever seen and they are just a wonderful hard working family. If I ever go back to LA I will definitely stay at the Beverly Inn even if it's only for the friendly service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: heatherh15
Reviews.Content: We picked the beverly inn because we seen online it was close to CBS studio. We took a shuttle to the hotel so we needed something within walking distance. When arriving the location of the hotel was perfect, it was directly across the street from CBS studio. We checked in and had to wait 10minutes for the room to finish getting cleaned. Later in the evening we noticed the AC wasnt working so the following day they switched our room. The owners were very nice, and helpful. The rooms werent super fancy, but you shouldnt expect that for 75$. just a simple room some updates have been made. The room met our needs and would recomend staying if you are going to CBS studio!! The farmers market was a nice place to get souveniers and a bite to eat for a very reasonable price. Also a tip if you are traveling without a car be sure to check out the metro stops!

Reviews.Title: “Ahyeti”
Reviews.Author: Alchonok
Reviews.Content: It is the worst place I have ever stayed the room is dirty the bathroom don't work and when you cAll the front desk they tell you come get the planger. The linons are old and when you ask for the towels they give the small towel .horeble

Reviews.Title: “This hotel has seen better days, unfortunately.”
Reviews.Author: retiredtravelers30
Reviews.Content: We wanted this hotel to be good, the price is great, the area is great, parking was good, staff was friendly, plenty of hot water, but, the bedspread was torn, the pillows were the size of towels, the lighting was bright neon with no shades, the staff was hanging bedspreads and blankets across the fence of the pool, you couldn't get ice after 7 PM ( and you had to pay for it), the room was dusty and yucky. This could be a great hotel, but I think it may be for sale.

Reviews.Title: “So dirty!! Wesite says "newly refurbished" YEAH RIGHT!!!! Yuck!”
Reviews.Author: Pinksoap
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed in here because we were going to The Grove Mall and the American Girl store for my daughter's birthday lunch in the AG Cafe. The location was the only thing good about this motel. Parking was OK, too. The rest was awful. The Beverly Inn website states it was newly refurbished!! No way! The walls were filthy dirty with brown drips and brown finger prints everywhere. The carpet (in our non-smoking room) had cig. burn holes, as well as our sheets on one bed. The blanket on one of the beds was full of long black hairs. The couch was was all ripped. It was dark and dreary inside too. Please don't stay here unless you don't mind dirty. The only reason we stayed here (even though I read previous reviews about it being dirty) was because they said it was refurbished and the price was cheap. I would have gladly paid double the price for a clean motel.

Reviews.Title: “Beverly Inn...update...Try it again”
Reviews.Author: EarthTraveler11
Reviews.Content: The Bevery Inn opposite CBS in Los Angeles appears to have 'cleaned up its act."...as they say. For the price ($65 single, $75 double) it is a great deal with walking distance to The Grove nearby at Farmers Mkt, CBS shows, Cantors LA-famous deli on Fairfax, as well as Beverly Hills. I have ben staying there on and off all year as a biz travler and have always found it fine. The rooms are clean, everything works (TV to great) and there are new touches here and there like shower curtains, bedding, etc., coffee maker. Parking is in back is well lit, but on first come basis with not as many spots as to accomodate all rooms, but there is lots of st parking too. Nearby places to get food...one blk over, opp the Post Office there is a great coffee shop, with Net service, a health food grocery store, Cantors deli abot 5 blks, away (great Jewish food, bakery) opp the coffee shop and 10 mins away is Farmers Mkt where there are 50 places to eat. If you like donuts, do not miss BOBS at the mkt, the best on the West coast. For Italian food try Maggiano's at the market. They also sell fresh fruit at the market too. There is Johnny Rockets, Dupars Coffeee Shop and for gumbo, try The Gumbo Pot. A stay at the Beverly Inn for a nite or two is a great deal and walking access to so many things, without fighting LA traffic. I recommend it. The young Indian couple that run the Bev Inn are very nice and helpful with any questions,. etc.

Reviews.Title: “not the ritz but it fits our needs”
Reviews.Author: nycbaby77
Reviews.Content: Well the hotel does not offer restaurant services, fancy spa services, nor a bar/lounge. However, what do you expect to receive when you spend about $75 per night? It did, however, have a pool and high-speed internet. If you are looking for an economic and limited services hotel then this is a good place to stay. We checked in a little ahead of schedule (10:00 am). Luckily the front desk was able to get us settled into the room and for the most we enjoyed our stay. The room was clean and it looks like they did some updates to the hotel. We stayed for three nights and did not have any problems with the staff or services. If you want a lot of hotel amenities, this may not be the place for you and you can stay at the Sofitel and probably pay four times more. If you want something cheap and clean, I suggest this place.

Reviews.Title: “Ick!”
Reviews.Author: HB29
Reviews.Content: This hotel is SO dirty. We booked this hotel because of it's proximity to CBS Studios for The Price is Right. We ended up having to sleep out on the street to save our place in line for the show and I cannot tell you how grateful I am! Very sad when one would rather sleep on the street than in this hotel. We used the room to go to the bathroom and shower. The shower was disgusting. There was mold and mildew on the walls and all over the shower curtian, seems that the owners have never heard of Tilex, let alone bleach. I sat on the bed, which is ROCK hard and the room had an odd, undescribable smell and we had a non-smoking room. They do not leave you any complimentary shampoos or lotions so if you do decide to book this hotel, bring your own. But my recommendation is that if you need a hotel close to the CBS Studio, read the reviews for The Gardenhouse Inn or The Farmers Daughter -- they're just as close.

Reviews.Title: “not so clean”
Reviews.Author: UtahTravelguru
Reviews.Content: We booked a room at this hotel because of the location. It is an easy walk to the CBS studios where we attended the Price is Right. When we first walked in it looked to be clean, but upon closer investigation we noticed MOLD in the shower, visibly dirty comforters and very OLD pillows that had lost their shape. The parking stalls were VERY close and we could BARELY get out without banging the car next to us. I paid $74 for this room and I don't think it was worth that. The pool is very small if you plan to swim. I would only recommend this hotel if you are without a car and need to walk to the CBS studios. Otherwise, try somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a good area and we called in advance to make certain that the room was clean for an early check-in. I was quite happy that they were able to accommodate me under short notice. The staff was nice to meet my needs. The room itself was a standard room. It is a small hotel and there was no restaurant on site. However, there are lots of places to eat close by so we had many choices. They have refrigerators in the room so we were able to keep our drinks cool. If you expect a 5 star hotel for amenities, then this is not the place. If you want a reasonable budget hotel then it will fit your needs like it did for me. I'll likely return.

Reviews.Title: “Beverly Inn.....bad, bad, bad, bad place.....”
Reviews.Author: hobdyville
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Beverly Inn because it was located across from CBS Studios and it was a great rate. The rooms smelled like India spices and the carpet was dirty and stained. The bathroom had mold growing all over the place and the comforter on the bed was badly stained, smelled bad and was just overall gross. The blanket on the bed smelled of cigarette smoke even though we were in a non-smoking room and it had numerous burned holes in it along with it being very rough to the touch and made my skin itch. The parking was very bad and it was very noisy. This place made me feel very dirty and not safe. I even placed a chair in front of the door to block it because of feeling not safe while staying there. The only thing good about this place was that the receptionist was very nice and gave very good directions and helpful hints to get around the city. I personally will never stay here again and would not recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, very poor facilities. One thing you could say - it's cheap!”
Reviews.Author: The_Traveller066
Reviews.Content: Surprisingly cheap, considering it's location (a stone throw from Beverly Hills/Hollywood Boulevard). However, the condition of the room and the rest of the hotel, left a lot to be desired. I stayed in one of their larger rooms, as I had my wife and kids with me. The door of the fridge wouldn't close, I had to ask for the TV to be changed as the images were green and white!! There were no coffee or tea making facilities, although one was provided the day after we arrived, as we said we must at least be able to make tea/coffee in our room! I booked and payed for hotel accommodation in the UK before flying to LA. Hotel had been advertised as serving breakfast and that this was included in the price. A big LIE! No food served in the hotel at all. This was a bit hard to handle, as the first things the kids normally ask for when they wake up is, can I have some breakfast please. As a result of this, we had to leave the hotel earlier than we normally would have done if breakfast was served, as had been advertised. I most certainly do not like being rushed when on vacation! Owners, who were of Asian origin (Indians) were very nice and helpful. They apologised for the mis-information and did their best to make our stay as comfortable as possible. We stayed for a week. If you are travelling on a budget, and want to stay in a place as close to the "stars" as possible, without having to pay a star price, this may be the place for you. However, I do not think I would recommend it to anyone or stay there again, myself.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap place to stay in a great area”
Reviews.Author: azrambler
Reviews.Content: This place is car motel that has seen much better days; the beds are old and offer no support, the televisions, carpets, and furnishings are likewise well-used, and the overall effect can be somewhat depressing. However, it does offer limited parking and convenient location at a very inexpensive rate and the bathrooms were clean; it attracts tourists who are more interested in the surrounding neighborhoods (which are quite nice with wonderful restaurants) and less interested in where they stay for the night. There was a cafe down the street when I was there in 2002, it's along major bus lines, with a terrific market close by across the street. It is also right across from the CBS studios, and about four blocks walking from an old-style diner and bakery. The comments on other sites focus on the ethnic background of the clerks and manager, but I found them pleasant and accommodating. That is why I actually felt safe there as a single female traveler (although I suspect others would not feel this way). This is just slightly above average for what you would expect for the price, but you do get what you pay for.

HotelInfo.Name: Beverly Inn
HotelInfo.Address: 7701 Beverly Blvd., Los Angeles, CA 90036
